meanings.definition: A person who reveres or respects someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The reverer of nature stood in awe of the towering trees.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a dedicated reverer of her ancestors' traditions.
meanings.sent3: The young reverer of superheroes had a collection of action figures.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, he was a true reverer of classical paintings.
meanings.sent5: The old man, a reverer of history, shared stories of the past with enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To regard with deep respect or admiration.
meanings.sent1: She would often reverer the wise advice of her grandmother.
meanings.sent2: He would reverer the bravery of the firefighters who saved his home.
meanings.sent3: The chef would reverer the secret recipe for the delicious soup.
meanings.sent4: The teacher would reverer the dedication of her hardworking students.
meanings.sent5: The artist would reverer the beauty of the sunset, capturing it in her painting.
